snippet: John Calipari and Mike Krzyzewski may possess varied temperaments, and their fans may nurse grudges, but their programs provide about as much of a contrast as their respective shades of blue.
abstract: Marc Tracy On College Basketball column argues despite perceived differences, college basketball powerhouses University of Kentucky and Duke University have similar approach; says in order to compete at sport's highest level, both teams have embraced reality of players leaving after one season to turn pro but Duke coach Mike Krzyzewski has done so reluctantly.
lead_paragraph: John Calipari and Mike Krzyzewski may possess varied temperaments, and their fans may nurse grudges, but their programs provide about as much of a contrast as their respective shades of blue.

headline.print_headline: Kentucky and Duke Are Looking More Alike All the Time
headline.main: Kentucky and Duke Are Looking More Alike All the Time
